description: From Dutch donderbus (“blunderbuss”, literally “thunder gun”), which was altered under the influence of blunder.

entries.meaning: An old style of muzzleloading firearm and early form of shotgun with a distinctive short, large caliber barrel that is flared at the muzzle, therefore able to fire scattered quantities of nails, stones, shot, etc. at short range.

verbs.description: blunderbuss (third-person singular simple present blunderbusses, present participle blunderbussing, simple past and past participle blunderbussed)
